name: catalog
content:
catalog noun
(LIST)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 [ C ] a book with a list of all the goods that you can buy from a store: a mail-order catalog
[ C ] a list of all the books, paintings, etc. that exist in a place
More examplesFewer examplesDo you often buy goods from mail-order catalogs?Our autumn catalog is now available from our usual stockists.Granddad was browsing through a seed and plant catalog.I've sent off for a catalog, as I can't get in to their Cambridge shop nowadays.If you order goods from the catalog, they usually arrive within the week.

catalog noun
(BAD EVENTS)
[ S ] A catalog of unwanted events is a series of them: The whole vacation was a catalog of disasters. a catalog of errors/crimes/complaints

to record something, especially in a list: Many plants become extinct before they have even been cataloged.

Add to word list
Add to word list
a listing, sometimes with explanations or pictures, of items offered for sale, of items that are available for use, or of objects described for a scientific purpose: The company’s spring catalog is filled with pictures of beautifully made clothing for girls. Students can search the library’s online catalog and order books. fig. I have a whole catalog of things that need to be done. catalog verb [ T ] (also catalogue) us

Scientists were cataloging the plants of their regions.
